basics.name: Wachyudi Sonang
basics.label: Front End Developer - Graphic Artist - User Experience Designer
summary: I'm a Web Front-End UI/UX Developer working in the beautiful city of Jakarta with excellent skill in designing and developing useful, simple, creative and easy-to-use online experiences. Well-versed in the latest web design trends and quick to learn new skills and readily adapt to new environments.
I'm into clean site design and structure with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, smooth UI architecture, strong branding adherence, and social media integration for mobile and the web.

highlights: Involved in the development and maintenance of the company’s 2 main products in the IOT industry: Nixplay Frames and Nixplay Signage Frames.
Containerized all of the company's microservices for development and deployment using Docker with orchestration handled by AWS Elastic Container Service.

Involved in end-to-end development of a new product from the ground up, working in Node.js to build the React.js frontend and distributed Express.js RESTful API, with DynamoDB and Aurora RDS MySQL database systems.
Engineered the in-use worker environment to interface with various SOAP and RESTful logistics courier APIs.
Introduced continuous integration and code coverage tools with Travis, Istanbul and Codecov, and created custom Docker containers to speed up testing execution.
Led an agile software development team of up to 8 engineers to maintain and extend the product as Tech Lead/Scrum Master.
Performed Product Manager duties and was responsible for development scheduling and product delivery.

Conducted literary research and psychophysical experiments in the area of human perception and developed the infrastructure using one of C++/Python/MATLAB and OpenGL 4.1, depending on the complexity and requirements of the task.
Developed a general experiment engine in Python and OpenGL to create 3D vision experiments, with GUI interface for participant data collection.

Led an agile software development team of 4 engineers to meet milestone requirements extending the company’s real-time group-buying data collection infrastructure, handling an hourly volume of ~100,000 database entries.
Wrote a Microsoft Excel based data entry updater in Python for client and internal use to amend all chronological entries pertaining to group-buying deals in the relevant collections within MongoDB.
Supervised and reviewed developments to the data collection system and deployed updates nightly.
Extended the Scrapy data collection system, adding a templating tool for crawler generation, quickening development time and accommodating for outsourcing.
Maintained and extended the Django-based crawler monitoring, client dashboard and RESTful API infrastructure through Python and PostgreSQL.
Collaborated in designing innovative corporate web solutions for e-commerce enterprises in ASP.NET and JavaScript, and provided support for the company’s existing systems through the in-house CMS.

Developed a personnel database web application in PHP and MySQL from the ground up, to be used between the company and a local telecommunications operator to keep track of employees with company funded mobile phone services.
Participated in this community service initiative that allowed students to plan and execute our own service: Bring Moxi to the Society.
In the event, we prepared computers and helped kindergartners to create their very own Moxi drawings using a stylus.
These drawings were then printed onto customized e-cards which could be sent to parents and loved ones.
Took donated food to rural settlements.
Educated under-privileged children on the dangers of HIV/AIDS.
Schooled children suffering from Down Syndrome on alternate weekends.

projects.name: Campus Guiding System
projects.summary: Campus Guiding System is a Google Maps-like application to provide directions within the HKUST campus. It calculates the shortest route between any two points in the university, using the Dijkstra's search algorithm. The system features a rich UI rendered in jQuery UI and jsDraw2D, providing map manipulation and location search functionalities. The backend is developed in PHP, utilizing MySQL as the database.
